New Records: Luis Severino pitched 7 innings, allowing only 1 run, with 5 strikeouts and 2 walks in the Mets' 4-1 win over the Red Sox on September 2, 2024.
Key Match Events: The Mets scored early runs on a Brandon Nimmo RBI double in the third inning and a Francisco Lindor run-scoring single in the fourth inning.
Luis Severino left the game after 7 innings, allowing only 1 run, and the Mets won their fifth consecutive game, moving them within a half-game of the Atlanta Braves for the NL Wild Card spot.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza, the Mets' manager, praised Severino's performance and noted the team's resilience after the win.
Severino credited his improved health and the support of the Mets' training and nutrition staff for his strong performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win marked the Mets' fifth consecutive victory and their first 10-game improvement since 2022.
The game was significant as the Mets approached the final weeks of the regular season with playoff hopes.
